body: Obi-wan: "You have become the very thing you swore to destroy"

The plot and art is so good that i spent about 2 hours reading it. I came for yuri but now i might into doujin have Stockholm syndrome involved. Urgh can anyone suggest a similar thing? Thanks in advamce
i usualy dont read but i loved this
There should be a spinoff that tells the story through Giselle's point of view starting from when Ashton first arrives at the mansion

I also find it ironic to see Ashton literally transforming to the once dreaded Vampire himself and killing humans even though if he was in his past self, this would've gone against his code of conduct.
Overall, this was a nice and unique story to read and I wouldn't mind re-reading it again.

This was a really bittersweet story with the bitter/feels part greater than the sweet part imho. When Douglas came, I knew something is gonna go wrong but I never expected him to kill his best friend with one fell swoop! Even worse! He didn't felt a single shred of remorse after killing his best buddy since childhood and one of his only friend who would lend a ear to him every now and then. 

Now I'm not well versed in human psychology but I do get the notion of caring for the thing that's right in front of you and forgetting about all past events but this scene was really feels all over for me. It's not anything new but this kinda stuff really proves an individual's greatest amount of love towards another being so much so that, you'd do everything even bury your past events and forget all about them so that your loved one won't hate you.
I also find what Giselle did afterwards kinda intriguing.

I am not a fan of gender bender or yuri but for some rason i rally like this 
good stroy and sex
I would have trouble eating the child of the only guy that cared about me from day 1, that I killed, even if he looked like bacon.
Damn, when you are horny af but the plot is actually interesting
